intro: Thalictrum purdomii, commonly known as Purdom's meadow-rue, is a flowering plant native to the western United States. It belongs to the Ranunculaceae family and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves and showy, pale yellow to greenish-white flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as meadows and streambanks. It is a perennial herb that can reach heights of up to 1 meter, with a rhizomatous root system. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
